meta.title: This American Life
meta.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.
meta.author: This American Life

episodes.title: 707: We Are in the Future
episodes.description: In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage in the wake of George Floyd’s death, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism. It’s a way of looking at Black culture that’s fantastic and hopeful, which feels especially urgent during a time without a lot of optimism. Featuring the song "The Deep" by clppng.
episodes.subtitle: In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism.

episodes.title: 706: A Mess to Be Reckoned With
episodes.description: Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. Cold cases, mostly. People no one else is looking for. It’s not her job, but a lot of Native Americans go missing and their cases remain unsolved, so families often ask Lissa for help. But then, Lissa’s own niece goes missing.
episodes.subtitle: Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. She's great at it. But then, her niece goes missing.

episodes.title: 705: Time Out
episodes.description: While sports of all kinds have been put on pause, we bring you favorite stories from back when people were still on football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts.
episodes.subtitle: Our favorite stories from the football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts of days past.

episodes.title: 704: Our Pulitzer-Winning Episode
episodes.description: Last week, our episode "The Out Crowd" won the very first Pulitzer Prize ever awarded to a radio show. This is the episode that won, with some updates on the stories. Hear what the Trump administration’s "Remain in Mexico" policy actually means, on the ground, at the Mexican border.
episodes.subtitle: What the Trump administration’s "Remain in Mexico" policy really means, on the ground, at the Mexican border.

episodes.title: 703: Stuck!
episodes.description: During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck.
episodes.subtitle: During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck.

episodes.title: 702: One Last Thing Before I Go
episodes.description: Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk.
episodes.subtitle: Ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones.

episodes.title: 701: Black Box
episodes.description: Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get. That, and other stories of people looking into the void for answers.
episodes.subtitle: Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get.

episodes.title: 700: Embiggening
episodes.description: Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known.
episodes.subtitle: Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known.

episodes.title: 699: Fiasco!
episodes.description: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong. When you leave the normal realm of human error, fumble, mishap, and mistake and enter the territory of really huge breakdowns. Fiascos. Things go so awry that normal social order collapses.
episodes.subtitle: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong.

episodes.title: 698: The Test
episodes.description: The coronavirus has now fully arrived in the United States. This week, stories of people trying to rise to that challenge, in some pretty extreme situations.
episodes.subtitle: Stories of people trying to rise to the challenge presented by coronavirus, in some pretty extreme situations.
